dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S1967 IS: Inventoried Roadless Area Management Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Barrasso introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To provide for the management of certain inventoried roadless areas, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Inventoried Roadless Area Management Act .

subsection.text: Congress finds that, for purposes of the second roadless area review and evaluation program (RARE II) and the land and resource management plan revision process under section 6 of the Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974 ( 16 U.S.C. 1604 ), the National Forest System land described in subsection (c) has been adequately studied for wilderness designation and should not be recommended as potential additions to the National Wilderness Preservation System.
The National Forest System land described in subsection (c)â€”

paragraph.text: is no longer subject to the land use restrictions of the Roadless Area Conservation Rule established under part 294 of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations); and
shall not be managed to preserve roadless or wilderness characteristics.

subsection.text: The National Forest System land referred to in subsections (a) and (b) is each of the inventoried roadless areas within the National Forest System in the State of Wyoming, as set forth in the maps contained in the Forest Service Roadless Area Conservation, Final Environmental Impact Statement, Volume 2, dated November 2000.
